snippet: The Commerce Department issued its final ruling Wednesday in a long-simmering trade dispute with China, imposing tariffs ranging from about 34 to 47 percent on most solar panels imported from the country.
abstract: Commerce Department issues its final ruling in long-simmering trade dispute with China, imposing tariffs ranging from about 24 to nearly 36 percent on most solar panels imported from country; case stems from legal filing in which a coalition of manufacturers contended that the Chinese companies were competing unfairly in the American market.

byline.original: By DIANE CARDWELL and KEITH BRADSHER

lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department issued its final ruling Wednesday in a long-simmering trade dispute with China, imposing tariffs ranging from about 34 to 47 percent on most solar panels imported from the country.

headline.main: U.S. Will Place Tariffs on Chinese Solar Panels
headline.print_headline: U.S. Will Place Tariffs On Chinese Solar Panels
